image.altText: A hospital bed is pushed down a corridor towards the camera.

props.synopsis: State health ministers will today enter their final meeting of the year with their federal counterpart armed with figures showing a 25 per cent increase in just three months of aged care patients stranded in hospitals.

title.children: More than 3,000 aged care patients stranded in hospitals a 'national shame'

image.altText: Profile of a man,

props.synopsis: Prosecutors in Greg Lynn's Victorian High Country murder trial are preparing for a second trial after the Court of Appeal quashed his conviction.

title.children: Greg Lynn's appeal was successful. What happens now?

image.altText: unidentified teenage girl talking to a doctor

props.synopsis: Hospital managers and executives in NSW will be barred from blocking abortions because of moral and religious views, according to a document obtained by the ABC.

title.children: NSW hospital execs could be barred from blocking abortions on religious grounds

image.altText: A US military helicopter appearing blue in a video screenshot with an abseil line hanging out a side-door over a boat

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's assertions on foreign policy since his return to the White House have literally stretched from one end of the Western Hemisphere to the other.

title.children: Trump's oil tanker seizure raises questions about potential Venezuela blockade

image.altText: anthony albanese

props.synopsis: Parents will thank the government for giving them more agency in dealing with the social media issue but kids aren't voters and it is hard to see the issue deciding votes either way.

title.children: Albanese's social media ban is bold, but it will take years to judge its success

image.altText: A designed image showing the Eagle Farm arch, horses racing on the track, apartment buildings and the BRC logo.

props.synopsis: Members of Queensland's richest horse racing club are demanding answers after they discovered its former chairman struck a lucrative deal with the developer of its luxury residential precinct while he had oversight of the $850 million project.

title.children: Backlash against Qld's richest race club over former chair's income

image.altText: Image (10)

props.synopsis: The treasurer and finance minister will need to find room for more than $12 billion in extra costs for "unavoidable" spending in the mid-year budget update. Follow live.

title.children: Mid-year budget update to show $12b spending blowout

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Andrew Bragg accuses PM of being a 'dodger' for evading review of expenses rules
Mid-year budget update to show large spending blowout

image.altText: Emma Mason in a black and floral shirt, with a flower in her hair, smiling, with a black wall behind her.

props.synopsis: Bathurst mother and lawyer Emma Mason's advocacy for Australia's social media ban has always been in honour of her late daughter, Tilly.

title.children: How a Bathurst mother stood up to world leaders on social media ban

image.altText: A group of tech CEOs sit on a metal construction beam, a throwback to a famous photograph of workers on a skyscraper.

props.synopsis: The magazine cites the tremendous technological advances made by the artificial intelligence industry over the past year in bringing on the age of "thinking machines".

title.children: TIME magazine names 'The Architects of AI' as Person of the Year

image.altText: A graphic image showing the NDIS logo, a hand on a calculator, and stacks of folders.

props.synopsis: The finer details of a new NDIS planning system are yet to be finalised, but it's already drawing comparisons to failed Coalition-era reforms, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

title.children: Fears around NDIS 'robo-plans' creating sense of deja vu

image.altText: A man with short black hair and a black goatee speaks to someone out of frame

props.synopsis: The case has become a key test of Donald Trump's immigration crackdown after Mr Abrego Garcia was wrongfully deported to El Salvador.

title.children: Judge orders immediate release of Kilmar Abrego Garcia from ICE detention

image.altText: Screenshots of advertisements on Chinese social media promoting illegal immigration to Australia

props.synopsis: Recent boat arrivals in Western Australia offer a glimpse into how routes through South-East Asia, particularly Indonesia, are being used to reach Australia.

title.children: How Chinese 'snakeheads' turn illegal migration toward Australia

image.altText: Ashley Griffith was photographed sitting with a child in his lap while employed at a daycare centre.

props.synopsis: Ashley Paul Griffith was sentenced to life in prison last year for sexually abusing 69 girls at childcare centres in Brisbane and Italy over a two-decade period.

title.children: Review leaves parents to grapple with failings that enabled paedophile

image.altText: A composite image showing the interior of a rundown prison cell

props.synopsis: The NSW's prisons watchdog has deemed parts of Long Bay Jail "unsafe" and "dilapidated" and "incapable of providing safe and humane" conditions.

title.children: Photos from scathing report show inside 'dilapidated' Sydney jail

image.altText: A large, old building in central Bendigo in Victoria

props.synopsis: Council officers recommend a one-year hiatus for the Bendigo Writers Festival to work on repairing the reputation of the event.

title.children: Bendigo Writers Festival in damage control, report recommends one-year break

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenksyy speaks in front of a Ukrainian flag.

props.synopsis: Ukraine has proposed a vote on disputed territory in an updated version of the US-led peace plan to end Russia's war.

title.children: Ukrainians could vote on disputed territory, Zelenskyy says in updated peace plan

image.altText: Bob Hawke and Paul Keating sit next to each other at a 1983 press conference.

props.synopsis: It was a pivotal moment in the nation's history, forever changing the way we were governed and the way in which we interacted with the rest of the world.

title.children: On a Friday afternoon in December, the buck really did stop here

image.altText: A moving image of a parachute getting stuck on the tail wing of a plane.

props.synopsis: Australia’s transport safety regulator has released video footage of a skydiver cutting himself free from his parachute after it became snagged on a plane wing in mid-air.

title.children: Video shows moment skydiver cuts himself free from tangled parachute

image.altText: Dylan Brown looks to pass for New Zealand in a Test match against Tonga

props.synopsis: The football Dylan Brown played for New Zealand should have won him the Golden Boot but it could also be the key to his record-breaking move to Newcastle.

title.children: Golden Boot or not, Dylan Brown's play for New Zealand can be the key for his record-breaking contract

image.altText: Beth Mooney holding her cricket bat after a shot

props.synopsis: Sydney Sixers keeper Alyssa Healy misses a glorious chance to dismiss Beth Mooney, and the Aussie left-hander makes her pay big-time with a sparkling innings.

title.children: Mooney capitalises on Healy's blunder to send Scorchers into WBBL final

image.altText: A woman standing in her kitchen holding two photo frames with pictures of her late husband

props.synopsis: Renee Ernst's world fell apart when her husband Troy was killed in a crash on his way home from work. She says consequences for dangerous driving need to be harsher.

title.children: Grieving families call for tougher penalties as NSW road toll surges

image.altText: A house in Brisbane with rooftop solar panels

props.synopsis: The $26 million pre-election commitment from the LNP is estimated by the government to save 6,500 households around $700 on energy bills, with applications opening on Friday morning.

title.children: Landlords to be paid for installing rooftop solar on rentals in Qld

image.altText: Donald Trump and Xi Jinping talk as they stand together.

props.synopsis: China's record breaking one trillion-dollar trade surplus shows Trump's tariffs have done little to tame Beijing's export juggernaut. In fact, they might have turbocharged it instead.

title.children: China's impressive trade surplus is making things hard for trading partners

image.altText: A woman squats crying into her hands which cover her face

props.synopsis: The latest strike reportedly killed multiple members of the same family and a months-old infant.

title.children: 'Vile and violent': Myanmar army bombs hospital killing at least 31 people

image.altText: An apparent explosion in bushland sends flames shooting into the air

props.synopsis: Fires in the city's north-east and south-east have been downgraded to watch and act levels, while lives and homes remain possibly under threat.

title.children: 'It's scary': Two fires in Perth's north and south downgraded from emergency level

image.altText: Tom Silvagni, whose name was suppressed throughout his criminal proceedings, pictured in a suit outside court.

props.synopsis: Tom Silvagni, the son of Carlton Football Club great Stephen Silvagni, can now be identified as the man last week found guilty of raping a woman in 2024, after a court lifted a restriction on publishing his name.

title.children: Tom Silvagni named as man from high-profile family convicted of rape

image.altText: image of woman in yellow dress holding pads and smiling

props.synopsis: When Samantha Bruce got her period in hospital she wasn't able to get a pad or tampon. She says the response left her feeling "small and dehumanised".

title.children: Woman denied period products in hospital says it's 'dehumanising'

image.altText: A man standing over a map and soil samples.

props.synopsis: The processing market is dominated by China, but Australia is building its capabilities in an attempt to boost the domestic industry.

title.children: First Australian rare earth processing facility under construction

image.altText: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte delivers a keynote address

props.synopsis: Mark Rutte said Moscow could be ready to use military force against NATO in five years, adding Europe should be prepared for war comparable to what "our grandparents and great-grandparents endured".

title.children: NATO chief warns Western allies: 'We are Russia's next target'

image.altText: A police officer in uniform surrounded by cameras in front of dark glass doors

props.synopsis: South Australia's top cop has taken on an extra role, joining the Adelaide Football Club's board of directors.

title.children: Adelaide Crows appoint Police Commissioner Grant Stevens to club's board

image.altText: Young girl with plaited hair standing with her back away from the camera wearing a purple jersey looking out into a footy field

props.synopsis: A growing rugby league excellence program is helping change the future of Queensland girls.

title.children: Girls rugby league excellence program teaching more than just footy skills

image.altText: Two men sitting side by side crossing their arms and looking angry

props.synopsis: Philip Shugg, a prominent accountant from Victoria's north-west, is facing an even lengthier prison sentence after pleading guilty to defrauding his clients.

title.children: Accountant facing longer prison sentence after $950,000 client fraud

image.altText: A blonde woman wearing a blue dress smiles in a venue.

props.synopsis: A high-profile British adult content creator will be banned from Bali for 10 years after police raided a "studio" on the island, in which 14 Australians were found.

title.children: Bonnie Blue to be banned from Bali after studio raid

image.altText: Tourists in front of the Lincoln Memorial

props.synopsis: Australians travelling to the United States could soon face an unprecedented invasion of privacy, an international law expert has warned.

title.children: Privacy concerns over US proposing travellers reveal social media history
